Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Downloading PDF files from a site using heritrix
 3.0 [3 Attachments]
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=UXHGtNe2_zDsXzPpDZsML1I7yscgRH3DfNXMqLBIl7Ts
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

Did your crawl of the site finish cleanly? (I just tried a test crawl of 
the same site, and many of the fetch attempts are timing out -- which 
could be network/server issues, or the site's own attempts to slow/block 
crawling.)

Are there any errors in the crawl.log or nonfatal-errors.log that refer 
to the URIs of interest?

Have you made any other changes to the configuration? (You can send me 
the crawler-beans.cxml file for review, either on the list or off-list, 
if you'd like.)

There shouldn't be any problem with the crawler using usual 
configuration starting at:

http://bip.kprm.gov.pl/

...following one navigational outlink ('L') to...

http://bip.kprm.gov.pl/kprm/nagrody/premiera/

...and then one more 'L' to...

http://bip.kprm.gov.pl/g2/2010_11/3678_fileot.pdf

However, currently many timeouts on page fetches are preventing my test 
crawl from reaching that PDF. Perhaps the same thing is happening for 
your crawls, and the proper fix is to both make the crawler more 
patient, and wait longer for the crawl to finish.

So, you may want to adjust the FetchHTTP 'soTimeoutMs' setting, to wait 
longer than 20000ms for a socket reply. (I've increased it to 60000 and 
I'm still seeing timeouts form the site.) Setting 'timeoutSeconds' to 
more than 1200 (20 minutes) may also be necessary.

Hope this helps,

- Gordon @ IA


On 12/9/10 3:38 PM, Maciej Grela wrote:
> 2010/12/7 Gordon Mohr<gojomo@...>:
>> There shouldn't be any problems getting PDFs or ZIPs using the default
>> settings, unless they are at paths blocked by robots.txt rules, or on a
>> separate hostname. (In either case small settings adjustments can ensure
>> they're retrieved.)
>>
>
> There aren't any robots.txt entries. The whole WARC I was able gather
> from the seed URL is here:
> http://mgrela.rootnode.net/public-data/PUBDATA-20101205225526-00000-kraken.warc.gz
> if anyone is interested.
>
>> Can you point out a specific URL that was downloaded, that links to a PDF
>> that wasn't downloaded, so I can investigate further? (I found no PDF or ZIP
>> outlinks on the URL<http://www.mf.gov.pl/index.php?const=6>.)
>>
>
> For example:
> HTML: http://bip.kprm.gov.pl/kprm/nagrody/premiera/ (present in WARC)
> PDF href:<a title="lista3.pdf"
> href="/g2/2010_11/3678_fileot.pdf">Laureaci nagród Prezesa Rady
> Ministrów za rozprawy doktorskie i habilitacyjne oraz działalność
> naukową, naukowo-techniczną lub artystyczną za rok 2009</a>
>
> The PDF file is not downloaded. By grepping I also found this entry
> about the link in a 'metadata' block:
>
> WARC/1.0
> WARC-Type: metadata
> WARC-Target-URI: http://bip.kprm.gov.pl/kprm/nagrody/premiera/
> WARC-Date: 2010-12-05T22:57:00Z

>
> via: http://bip.kprm.gov.pl/kprm/
> hopsFromSeed: L
> fetchTimeMs: 375
> ( ... snip ... )
> outlink: http://bip.kprm.gov.pl/g2/2010_11/3678_fileot.pdf L a/@href
> ( ... snip ... )
>
> What does it mean ?
>
> Best regards,
